fields.summary: Issue teste

fields.description:
1) Ticket was in "In Branch QA", then it was changed to "Reopened" using Jira API.
2) Change is done in logs. Also all actions are associated with new "Reopened" status. But in the ticket info it was said, that it is still in old one - "In Branch QA"
3) Then the "Start" action button was pressed it was moved to "In Progress" as it was in "Reopened" before. There is no such an action - "Start" in "In Branch QA" status.

See screenshot attached!
fields.summary: State was partially changed during transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42780].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA, according to the [Atlassian Design Guidelines|https://design.atlassian.com/2.1/product/patterns/date-formats/] relative dates are shown such as "Yesterday". The absolute date and time can be shown using a tooltip.

Earlier versions of JIRA presented the relative date as "Yesterday 5:00pm", which helped JIRA users determine _when_ yesterday the date is making reference to, which is useful when dealing with young dates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue in JIRA (version 6.3+)
# Wait a day.
# Observe the Created date is in-line with the Atlassian Design Guidelines
# Observe that there is no option to show the time without hovering over the date.

h3. Expected Results
A method to show the relative date with a time.

h3. Actual Results
No option to show the relative date with the time.

h3. Notes
This is not a bug, but a feature request. The documentation [Customizing the Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+the+Look+and+Feel#CustomizingtheLookandFeel-Date/TimeFormats] provides details about Time Formats in JIRA.

h3. Workarounds
# Using the tooltip, users can see the absolute value of a JIRA date.
# Following the steps in: [Disable Relative Dates in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Disable+Relative+Dates+in+JIRA]
fields.summary: Display Relative Dates with Time in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42779].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JIRA documentation does not mention Deleting issues. This is causing some confusion for users who would like to know:
- What happens when an issue is *Deleted*
- What precautions should be taken.

h3. Expected Results
A page under [Working with an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Working+with+an+Issue] should document how to delete an issue, and the effect this has.

h3. Actual Results
No page for deleting an issue can be found.

h3. Notes 
As per the screenshot JIRA presents some guidance when a user trys to delete an issue:

{quote}
Please confirm that you wish to delete this issue.

Deleting an issue removes it permanently from JIRA, including all of its comments and attachments.

If you have completed the issue, it should usually be resolved or closed - not deleted.
{quote}

However this is not documented.
fields.summary: Documentation on Deleting Issues in JIRA

Combine Release Notes from Multiple Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42769].
  {panel}

Hi, is there a way to quickly and easily see a timesheet for my own user for today?

I want to be able to see what Hours I've logged for today.

That way, if it's the end of the day I can check to see if I forgot to log any hours on anything.

Or, more importantly, I can see WHEN the last time I logged hours was. Sometimes I will work on Task B without knowing what time I started Task B. I only know that I started Task B immediately after I logged hours for Task A. But I don't know when I logged hours for Task A. There are a couple ways to find out, but they are all really tedious. I could go to my profile and look through my activity stream, I could try to remember which ticket Task A was and look at its Work Log, I could try to use the Reports page but they are a hassle.
fields.summary: Quickly see my own timesheet (work log) for today?
Add ability to create pre-commit reviews in Crucible through JIRA
Documentation Update for Oracle 12c driver

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42763].
  {panel}

Quite often when troubleshooting, the JIRA logs can be inundated with errors to the point where its not possible to distinguish events. Additionally, repeating errors have the side effect of making the logs roll, which means we can't go back a day or so. In those cases we typically do a "wait and see" while we keep our ear to the ground. 

Suggested log structure for JIRA Cloud to help alleviate said conditions above: 

*JIRA logging:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/jira

*Mail logging:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/mail

_Add-On logging (would be specific to customer):_

*Service Desk:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/servicedesk

*JIRA Agile:*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/agile

*Tempo*
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/tempo

Etc.
fields.summary: Parse JIRA logs into subfolders

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42761].
  {panel}

h3.Summary

Undo is not working correctly in the description field. 

h3.Steps to replicate

* Type a sentence in the summary field. Copy this sentence.
* Enter twice to register 2 line breaks.
* Paste the sentence copied earlier. Undo the changes with Ctrl+z.

h3.Expected Result

The undo should undo the changes line by line. It will undo the the paste; the 2nd line break; the first line break and then focus the cursor at the end of the first sentence.

h3.Result

The undo removes all changes; removing both the line breaks and focusing the cursor back at the end of the first sentence.
fields.summary: Undo not working properly

The HTML tags are no longer supported but the descriptions of the custom fields (Radio Buttons in this case) is still showing the example in using the HTML tags.

!option tags.png|thumbnail!

Also update https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/cloud/Configuring+a+Custom+Field#ConfiguringaCustomField-options to let readers know that HTML tags are not supported.

Some permissions rely on other permissions and that is not clear.

For Example: If a user has "Resolve Issues" but not "Transition Issues", the user will not be able to Resolve Issues.

Reorganizing the permissions Hierarchically based on dependencies like above would improve the usability of Permission Schemes administration.

*EDIT*: Updating the documentation in regards of these dependability could help as well

I would like to create issue type avatars that are larger.  I know you guys love the 16x16 pixel image,...but...I can't see them, I can't remember what they are, and they don't make sense.

Here is an example of the image/avatars I would like to use on Issue Types:

!feature.png|thumbnail!
!epic.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42751].
  {panel}

I have read through this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Cloning%20an%20Issue?continue=https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Cloning%20an%20Issue?src=search 

I would like to suggest that the same option which exists for Reporter (that it will list me as the reporter when I clone an issue) to also be setup for the Assignee.

As an example we have users call our Helpdesk and if they have the same or even a similar issue I would like to be able to clone it (thus saving me lots of time trying to fill out the work order request (/trouble ticket)) and just readjust the Summary and Description without anyone else needing to be notified via email that I had made a clone of the previously closed/completed work order (unless the admin must see it) just because they had helped this person in the past and was listed as the Assignee.
Since I am taking the call I would expect that I would be the Reporter and that I would also be the Assignee.

Another example is I have a work order with 4 sub-tasks for when we have a newly hired student worker. These sub-tasks go out to their respective areas requesting activation of an account or access to a network folder etc. Now the student is graduating and will no longer be working for us. I would like to open up that initial work order which says, "please grant access to. . . " Clone it and all the sub-tasks and have all of them assigned to me as Reporter and Assignee. Then all the information is there for the name of the student, their account, the access they needed, etc. Next I change the wording from "please grant access to. . . "  to  "remove access from . .  " on each of the work orders. Then assign it from me to the other individual/area for completion.

Right now if I clone the work order in the example above an email is generated to all the individuals in the sub-tasks and the wording in the Summary for those sub-tasks says that it is a Clone - . I have no opportunity to change anything in the sub-tasks just the main work order. Then any changes I make to the work order will send them an email, unless I change the assignee from them to me. Then on each of the sub-tasks I remove the "Clone-" from the Summary, remove/add labels and change the verbiage to "remove access from" in the description and then change the assignee back to that person.

If I automatically became the Reporter and the Assignee then all the emails for any change I make are not needed until the Work Order and sub-tasks are ready to be seen.

Here's for Hoping the Assignee can also have the option to be like the Reporter and be automatically given to the person Cloning the Work Order.  Thanks for listening.
Kris
fields.summary: Update or Extra Option to the way Cloning is Handled
Show release version on issue links section of JIRA issue page
Audit log for changes to Resolutions configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42743].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition
Let's assume this use case scenario

# Create an issue with Original Estimate of 5h
# Log work of 1h, and the Remaining Estimate will automatically be calculated to be 4h
# Edit the issue and change the Original Estimate to 8h
# Leave Remaining Estimate value as is and proceed with Edit

You will see that Original Estimate is changed to 8h, Time Spent still maintains at 1h, but Remaining Estimate also maintains at 4h (doesn't auto recalculate to 7h)

h3. Suggested Solution and Why this is important
As a manager, it is tedious to have to manually count the Remaining Estimate every time we want to update the Original Estimate. We would preferably just edit the Original Estimate, such that the Remaining Estimate will be automatically calculated.

h3. Workaround 
* Currently, the only workaround is to update the remaining estimate value manually based on the *Original Estimate* new value and the *Time Spent* value.
fields.summary: Automatically calculate Remaining Estimate when Original Estimate value changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42742].
  {panel}

It looks like that catalina.pid is not removed during linux shutdown process.
Tomcat is killed by SIGTERM rather than stop-jira.sh.

Tomcat startup abort if same PID of catalina.pid exist after restart linux.

*Environment*
* RHEL/CentOS Linux
* JIRA Linux Installer
* Service enabled

*Suggestion*
* adding some codes to /etc/rc.d/init.d/jira script
** chkconfig 345 85 15
** touch /var/lock/subsys/jira after start
** remove this lock file after stop

*Workaround*
* run stop-jira.sh before shutdown linux system
fields.summary: graceful service stop during linux shutdown process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42732].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
Start a search in issue navigator.
Select an issue.
Click on "More" button and click on watchers

On this screen is a "back to issue" button.

This doesn't take you back to the issue navigator. It puts you into the issue where you clicked on "watchers" only.

Either the button should take me to where I was prior to navigating to "watchers" or take the button away and users can use the back button on their browser (which I have to click twice to get back to search in navigator).
fields.summary: Back to issue button from Watchers Screen doesn't go "back"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42731].
  {panel}

I've had to change a few workflow schemes recently and find it to be very annoying. Here's the problem: 

!screenshot-1.png|width=50%|height=50%!


The switch scheme screen show every issue type and every status that's changed in that issue type. Some of the issue types have 0 issues of that type. 








The status of an open "Operations" issue type has 0 affect on how the project is going to be affected as there are NO issues of that type. 

Proposed new feature; Only show issue types that have > 0 issue count. 

This way, the clutter doesn't affect me when I am mapping the issue. (If I get annoyed with all these 0's I have almost missed a non-0 issue type).
fields.summary: Hide issue types with 0 issues on switch workflow scheme screen

fields.description:

It would be better to improve the visibility of an inactive workflow that is associated to a workflow scheme which has an unpublished draft .

For now, the only indicator is this little tiny icon next to the workflow scheme :

!draft.png|thumbnail!

It is too small and un-noticeable. 

This issue first started with the user unable to delete an inactive workflow as below:

!Inactive-WF.jpg|thumbnail!

Take note how it does't show which workflow scheme it is associate to, at the same time the user is unable to delete the workflow. 

It could be better, if it shows that is it still associated to the workflow scheme which has an unpublished draft.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42721].
  {panel}

When a JIRA instance is configured, the user going through the installation wizard is forced to go over 12 steps showing how to use JIRA.

This can be a hassle for users that are already familiar with JIRA and are just setting up new instances. 

Adding a Skip button would reduce friction.

For users logging in for the first time, it's possible to disable this by following the steps of [How to Disable User Onboarding in JIRA 6.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Disable+User+Onboarding+in+JIRA+6.4]
fields.summary: Add Skip option to JIRA Onboarding

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42709].
  {panel}

The actual page [Allowing users to create issue anonimously|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Allowing+users+to+create+issues+anonymously] could be more clear. Some users (as you can see [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/132222/how-can-i-allow-anonymous-users-to-create-issues]) are missing the step to make the Reporter optional. I suggest changing this documentation to something similar to the following:

{quote}
JIRA can be configured to allow users to create issues without having logged into JIRA. There are two related actions:

# Allowing users to browse and search issues in the project without logging in.
## Add the Anyone group to the *Browse Project* ﻿of permissions in the permission scheme for the project.
# Allowing users to create issues in that project without logging in.
## Add the Anyone group to the *Create Issue* of permissions in the permission scheme for the project.
## Set the *Reporter﻿* at the project's field configuration scheme to optional.
Any issue created by a user who is not logged in will display 'Anonymous' for the reporter of the issue.
{\quote}

Best regards,
Daniel P Santos
fields.summary: Reduce the customer friction from an Atlassian Document page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42706].
  {panel}

We have released new versions of [Tempo Core|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.tempoplugin.tempo-core/versions] and [Tempo Teams|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.tempoplugin.tempo-teams/versions] in Tempo products and on the Atlassian Marketplace.

Included in both versions is Atlassian Connect compatibility and Tempo Teams has in addition few translations improvements and a bug fix.

Sverrir Tynes
Tempo QA and support manager
fields.summary: Update Request for Tempo Core and Tempo Teams on Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42705].
  {panel}

As a JIRA System Administrator, I'd like to be able to manage user memberships easily.

In JIRA 6.4, when you go to _Users > username > Actions > Edit User Groups_ you need to type and choose a group. While in older versions it was possible to select all groups at once. Or to select multiple ones by holding CMD and clicking.

In addition, it is not possible anymore to see the full list of available groups from the drop down.
This can be very inconvenient, in particular when users are required to get added to a large amount of groups manually.
fields.summary: Change edit group membership to a multi-select field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42704].
  {panel}

Hello,

We currently use Jira OnDemand, and I've set up several dashboards for use in our regular meetings. I've also got lots of filters set up to help us navigate to the relevant issue lists for each section of the meeting.

What I'd like to see is a gadget similar to the "Favourite Filters" gadget, but instead of only showing the favourite filters (where each user can only have one list), you can specify a list of filters to use in this instance of the gadget. That way I could have a different filter list on each dashboard, and also have other information and graphs on there.

At present I've achieved this using multiple "Filter Results" gadgets and limiting to one item per list, but this isn't practical and a list of filters in the same format as "Favourite Filters" would be much better. I looked into writing my own, but apparently you can't write custom gadgets for OnDemand (accoriding to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Restricted+Functions+in+Cloud+Applications)

I tried searching the project for existing items but couldn't seem to find anything, apologies if I missed it.

Many thanks,
James
fields.summary: "Selected Filters" Gadget for OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42700].

Attached are some screenshot(sorry they are small but that was the easiest way to highlight the issue) showing the problem.

Ismael.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42688].
  {panel}

Steps to Reproduce:
* Login as a user and assign an issue to himself / herself.
* As an admin remove the assignable user permission to the above user.
* Login as the user and open assignee list in the issue used above.

Expected:
* Users that are not assignable should not be present in the assignee list

Actual Result:
* The current user is seen in the drop-down, even though the user is not assignable.

Note: Current user is "All the basic permissions", whom does not have assignable permissions
fields.summary: If the current assignee on an issue is no longer assignable he should not appear as a suggestion in JIRA's assignee picker list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42687].
  {panel}

As an admin, I would like to configure a notification to HipChat when an issue is commented. 

It would be good if:
* I can choose what issues trigger notifications using JQL 
* I can choose to include the body of the comment in the notification to HipChat
** I may want to include the comment body, or I may just want a notification saying "Comment Added" or something similar.

A workaround is discussed in [this Answers post | https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/186544/posting-jira-issue-comments-to-hipchat]
fields.summary: Notify HipChat when JIRA issue is commented

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42686].
  {panel}

The old XML-RPC API provided a method for getting the list of suggested labels using the endpoint: /rest/api/1.0/labels/suggest

This API is very useful for clients to provide feedback to users and keep the set of used labels consistent.

According to the [deprecation notice|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/api-reference/jira-api-status/jira-rpc-services/jira-xml-rpc-overview/soap-and-xml-rpc-api-deprecation-notice] for the XML-RPC and SOAP APIs it looks like this endpoint will not be supported in JIRA 7.0.  I don't see it in the current Javadoc for the SOAP API that is targeted for migration.

Given that the JIRA OnDemand web UI uses this deprecated call too I suggest it be announced as officially supported in JIRA 7.0.
fields.summary: Provide REST API for listing the set of know labels
Move "Cancel" link to another place on the create issue form
Would like to mass sort custom field and edit individual values across a group of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42668].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
This is a logging bug. There seems to be no functional problem from the UI side.

When clicking on an mp4 attachment, it will play the video in the web browser with no indication of any problem, but JIRA logs a {{ClientAbortException}}.
* This doesn't seem to happen for small files that are less than 1 MB (rought estimate)
* For files that are a couple MB in size, it happens upon first request, but not after. I believe this is because of caching
* I've been able to always reproduce this with larger files of great than a couple hundred MB

h3. Environment
Reproducible on the browsers below: 
- Chrome 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit) 
- Safari 7.1 (9537.85.10.17.1)

The error does not happen when streaming the video on Firefox 37.0.2. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a .mp4 video file to an issue ticket (e.g. [^SampleVideo_360x240_5mb.mp4]).
#* Use larger files for best results
# Click on the video, which will cause it to start playing in your web browser

h3. Expected Results
No errors are written to the logs.

h3. Actual Results
The errors below will be written to the JIRA logs:

Instances using APR (Apache Portable Runtime) will have a slightly different stack trace. The problem is still reproducible in those environments though.

Preconditions:
JIRA handles users via Atlassian ID.
Make sure that Gravatar is picked in AID Account settings and that there is no image set in Gravatar service for user.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Log into JIRA with Atlassian ID.
2. Create issue.
3. Check the inbox of your email.


Expected Result:
Default avatar must be shown in the email (user picked Gravatar but has no Gravatar set in Gravatar service).

Actual Result:
Broken avatar image is shown in the email. It seems default avatar image is not attached inline to the email.

h3.Summary
Excel report generated from Atlassian Cloud show warnings when it is opened in Excel 2013. While the document can still be opened; it can be annoying after multiple times.

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
* Generate an Excel report from Atlassian Cloud instance.
* Open the Excel report in Excel 2013

Expected Results:
* Excel report opens without any warnings.

Actual Results:
* A warning message box is displayed when the report is opened in Excel 2013.


!Jira Excel Export error.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Excel 2013 shows warning when opening Excel reports generated from Atlassian Cloud
Security Bugfix Policy update
Average Age Chart - Average Age Chart - have option to exclude weekends in calculation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42617].
  {panel}

The "Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy" option available in JIRA's General Configuration page can be used to turn off rendering of inline attachment including images when set to "Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers". 

However it appears it's possible to escape this rendering setting for the inline image markup by using it with other wiki markup such as a pipe/quote/numbered/bulleted lists to the inline image markup.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Set "Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy" to "Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers" in General Configurations.
* Try to render an image attachment inline using \!image.png\!
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \|\!image.png\! as well.
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \*\!image.png\! as well.
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \#\!image.png\! as well.
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \{quote}\!image.png\! \{quote} as well.

*Expected Behavior*
* Image is not rendered in any of the above cases based on the setting

*Actual behavior*
* Image is rendered when markup is used along with the pipe/quote/numbered/bulleted lists etc.
fields.summary: Certain wiki markup characters can be used to escape Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy

The Give Feedback link in Project Sidebar is not ideal in several ways:
# Users do not know where their feedback will be sent to
# The pop-up form is in English and there's no way to have it translated
# Sidebar might already be familiar to users who also use Confluence
# The link/icon's position is disturbing

It would be best if this link/icon can be made configurable so that JIRA admins can hide it or put it to a different position.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42574].
  {panel}

I don't know if this is a bug or not (there is no documentation on how this should work).

1. Pull up an issue (for example PROJ-2) by going directly to it.
2. Pull up another issue in a different project ( for example OTHER-23 ) by going directly to it.
3. In the "Projects" tab - note that the Current Selected project is OTHER.
4. Use the Issues dropdown to change the issue to PROJ-2.

In the "Projects" tab the current selected project is still other.

This manifests as well in the JIRA api where there JiraHelper object returns back the previous project. It seems that the project only changes when you go directly to an issue.

Is this the intended behavior?
fields.summary: Current selected project doesn't change when you go a different issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42558].
  {panel}

If you go to to >>
- administration cog
- Issues
- Custom Fields
- Select configure on a custom field
-- https://<INSTANCE NAME>/secure/admin/ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa?customFieldId=<CUSTOM FIELD ID#####>

The Wrench Option and delete option are very close together and accidentally clicking the Delete option while clicking the Wrench will immediately delete the context without warning.

h2.Suggestion to Users:
Use the Edit Configuration Link rather than the wrench icon.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42556].
  {panel}

While HiChat may seem as an interesting option for small comanies or for very small teams that do work totally isolated from the rest of the company, it has almost no chances to sucess in Corporate.

Most corporations are using Microsoft Lync and some of them do also use the XMPP interface for Lync.

Use case: the entire company is using Lynx for internal communications (>10k employes) and we do want to benefit from IM integration in Jira and Confluence.

Third Party Connector for JIRA Server
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.benryan.jira.plugin.lync-connector

Third Party Connector for Confluence Server
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.benryan.confluence.plugin.lync-connector

Neither are available for Cloud.
Neither provide the notification abilities of HipChat
fields.summary: Support for Lync in JIRA and HipChat
SWiM

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42551].
  {panel}

*oops, I just found JRA-40284. Mine is a duplicate of that one-- but I don't have permission to resolve my own issue as duplicate. Sorry JIRA team about the spam!*

When I'm creating a new issue, it's often related to the current page I'm viewing. For example, when viewing a list of issues, I may want to refer to the issue number of an existing issue in the description of the new issue. Or when reviewing a resolved issue, I may spot a problem with the solution that we'll need to address in a future release. 

But because the create dialog hides a large percentage of the screen, I often can't see the info in back that I need to refer to in my issue. This means I often have to decide to either abandon my new issue and re-type whatever I've typed so far, or to save the incomplete issue and immediately edit it. 

I know that I can open the create form in a new tab and bypassed this problem, but often I don't realize that I need info from the page until after I'm already midway through entering info in the dialog.

Could JIRA modal dialogs be enhanced to allow moving dialog boxes out of the way by making the dialog header draggable?  

FWIW, most modern web apps already support this behavior, perhaps because jquery.dialog and other frameworks' dialog widgets offer this behavior by default.
fields.summary: As an issue creator, I want to drag the modal dialog out of the way so I can see what's in back of it
Limit a number of sub-tasks creation in a parent issue screen
No workflow actions on issues due to SQL exception in Create/Edit screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42547].
  {panel}

https://jira.atlassian.com/ ->
in my profile, change page size from default of 50 to 1000 ->
navbar -> Issues -> Reported by Me ->
observe 3 (soon to be 4 issues) in results (I use List View) ->
click the circled x beside 'Reporter: Current User', removing that criteria from the filter ->

Actual result:
observe a very long pause where nothing is happening ->
observe 1000 results displayed

Expected result:
observe a throbber indicating progress is occuring ->
observe 1000 results displayed

Without a throbber, it looks like the query has failed silently. In fact it is succeeding silently.

The throbber from the Activity Stream would be sufficient.
fields.summary: Filter queries don't have a throbber while loading results
Duplicate links on Retrieving the JIRA Administrator documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42544].
  {panel}

I've opened a Jira that had collapsed comments, and manually uncollapsed the comments. Then I press the arrow to switch the comment ordering.

Actual result:
Comments are recollapsed, same as they were when I opened the Jira.

Expected result:
Manual uncollapsing is preserved.

I'd expect collapsing to be reapplied (aka manual uncollapsing is forgotten) when the issue is opened for the first time in a browser tab. So having it open in one tab, then opening in a new tab, the new tab gets collapsing. Reloading the original tab preserves its manual uncollapsing.
fields.summary: Changing the comment ordering re-applies the collapsing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42543].
  {panel}

Sometimes I get assigned a Jira that's already had a lot of activity. I've never opened it before. I open it for the first time for me.

Actual result:
Some comments are collapsed.

Expected result:
Only comments that I have seen before are collapsed.

Generally, I like the comment collapsing, it's a nice feature. I think the behaviour could greatly improved though, the above actual/expected result is just once specific instance of not-quite-working-the-way-I-expect.

Here's my vision, these are all per-user settings \[default value]:

'How many comments collapse?': All, None, X, Show X and collapse remaining \[Show 3]
'Always show unseen comments': checked/unchecked \[checked]
  +-> 'Unseen comments do/don't count for collapsing': Do, Don't \[Don't if 'Always Show' is checked, disabled if unchecked]

Comments that haven't been seen have a visual marker to indicate that they are unseen.

Example 1:

The user has chosen:
'How many comments collapse?': Show 5 and collapse remaining
'Always show unseen comments': checked
'Unseen comments do/don't count for collapsing': Don't

An issue that has not been opened before: All comments would be shown, they are all unseen.

An issue that has been opened, and has had no new comments added since: the most recent comments are shown, up to 5 of them, and any remaining are collapsed.

An issue that has been opened, and has new comments: The unseen comments are shown, plus up to 5 of the most recent seen comments are shown, and the remainder are collapsed.

Example 2:

The user has chosen:
'How many comments collapse?': Show 3 and collapse remaining
'Always show unseen comments': unchecked
'Unseen comments do/don't count for collapsing': \[disabled]

An issue that has not been opened before: Show up to 3 comments, collapse remaining

An issue that has been opened, and has had no new comments added since: Show up to 3 comments, collapse remaining

An issue that has been opened, and has new comments: Show up to 3 comments, collapse remaining
fields.summary: Comments collapsed without having been seen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42542].
  {panel}

Ordering of comments on issues can be ascending or descending. I like the order that is opposite of what my IT dept has set as the server-wide default. I change it, but then later it reverts back to the default.

Actual result:
My preferred ordering for comments is not remembered forever.

Expected result:
My preferred ordering is remembered forever.

What I think the problem is:
Ordering of comments is stored per-session, but should be stored per-user instead.

I believe this is possible because other settings** are stored per-user and persist across sessions.
**An example is Details View vs List View for search results. I didn't like the default so chose the other setting, and my selection persists forever. Therefore it is a per-user setting, not a per-session setting.
fields.summary: Comment ordering setting stored per-session
system mail handler to give the received mail sender and all CCed a standard notification
